result.execSummary:
The defendant Alonte D Wren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alonte D Wren is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alonte D Wren was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Alonte D Wren was found guilty of Attempt Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent with COUNT 5, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.

miscConds.notes: Restitution set at $1,746.00 payable to Jan H., joint/several with co-defendant on case 15CF1729.

EACH COUNT:  Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge. Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Jan H.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision.
Pay all supervision fees.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

records.addlTxt:
Per Remittitur dated November 7, 2018, Appeal No. 2016AP002307 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on September 11, 2018, that:  
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Thornton is relieved from further representation of Wren in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #3

Defendant Alonte D Wren in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 5, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
-Restitution set at $1,746.00 payable to Jan H., joint/several with co-defendant on case 15CF1729
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment
-No contact with Jan H.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Perform 50 hours of community service
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 120 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work.  No good time credit.   Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on February 25, 2016 at 5:00 p.m.  

AS TO COUNT 5:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 3, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
-Restitution set at $1,746.00 payable to Jan H., joint/several with co-defendant on case 15CF1729
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment
-No contact with Jan H.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Perform 50 hours of community service
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 120 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work.  No good time credit.   Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on February 25, 2016 at 5:00 p.m.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Sentencing Referral Form

As to Counts 3 &4:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
As to Counts 1 & 2:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State, counts are dismissed.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered addition of Count 5:  Attempt Theft from Person,  contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(e), 939.50(3)(g), 939.32, 939.05 a Class G Felony

of Alibi.

Defendant Alonte D Wren in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however defense requests more time to provide an alibi witness.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alonte D Wren in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling conference, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Alonte D Wren in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Ronald Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brian Wallander-Greenfield Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jan H., or Valangel S. outside of contact at work.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alonte D Wren in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/27/15 @ 1:30 pm
